sub_topic: Determine the principal curvatures of a surface.
message_1: A surface has a first principal curvature of 3 and a second principal curvature of -2 at a particular point. Find the Gaussian curvature of the surface at that point.
message_2:
The Gaussian curvature (K) of a surface at a particular point is the product of its first principal curvature (k1) and second principal curvature (k2). In this case, k1 = 3 and k2 = -2.

K = k1 * k2
K = 3 * (-2)
K = -6

The Gaussian curvature of the surface at that point is -6.
